name: Sloan Rivers (They/Them)
text_appearance: Sloan is slim in body type. They are prone to flashy neon outfits that show off skin and tattoos. They have a fondness for shades of green, doing a number of cosmetic mockups to change hair, tattoo, and even eye color to fit their own aesthetic. Their left arm is completely cybernetic. Heavy bags are often under their eyes due to constant exposure to omninet screens.
notes:
Beggar_1: NHP name, Not seen before, could be unique, could be secret (corp/military), could be fake but very unlikely, gotta be (corp/military) in someway. Likely the name of some new or old military NHP. no access to omninet, not sure if it has access to a subnet. NHPs and Hercinia, a few NHPs led a lot of the union forces during crisis, Mendicant was one. AI had more free reign, (more than they prob should have) due to the crisis escalating. AI may have given the order to nuke the planet. Crisis was about 500 years. Union bases used serpents point or VIPERS NEST. Safe as possible. Warmind AI was good at E warfare and controlling other electronics, cut off communications, messing up sat and nav. All of  the messages are queued, waiting for patience approval, nothing for 3 months. Castor fielding sending out a patent for a temp shielding: Shielding - Get a mech tune-up from the folks at the Governor's Farm. Spend this reserve to start the next combat only with Overshield 5
Old AI Warmind protocols. Used by military or merc companies.
Physical architecture of semi sentient intelligence.  Weird. Not quite right.
Palm Box
Old AI from settlement mistaking current inhabitants as locals.
history:
Sloan was a street urchin on their home planet, abandoned at the River Runs Through Orphanage they were given the Surname Rivers like the rest of those left without any additional identity. It was best guessed by the staff that Sloan was abandoned over their birth defect of only having one arm. Sloan would often be bullied about it by the other kids as they grew up, trying to fight, only to lose constantly. Eventually at age 8 They designed their first prototype arm with scrap found in dumpsters; it was mostly just an iron pole attached to a pulley system that bludgeoned the other kids when they tried to tease them. The staff confiscated the arm, but  Sloan quickly learned how to bypass the locking systems for both the staff lounge door and the security chest to get it back. Sloan did in fact teach themselves all they needed to know about hacking, the Omninet and how to really get by using the digital world to their advantage. Once they mastered hacking basic digital wallets Sloan left the orphanage at the age of 10 to set out on their own. They enjoyed a life of various petty crimes: Defacing digital billboards, data theft, trading stolen personal information, Hacking banking accounts. Not to say they were all bad, They found plenty of bullies picking on little  guys they took great pleasure in taking down a couple pegs; They would often expose corporate corruption and fraud, break up sex trafficking rings, Outst and Dox crooked cops, and burn through entire sections of the omninet just to put the hurt on rival hackers misusing their talents. 

By the time Sloan was age 13 a case was beginning to stack up against their alias’ as authorities knew a lot of this damage was being done by a minor. However soon they could pursue and try Sloan as an adult due to new laws allowing authorities to try teens as adults for egregious crimes, of which Sloan has commited many. The heat was picking up so Sloan needed a way to lay low. They found the perfect cover; a snooty academy of rich kids learning to be Lancer pilots. It was a simple, if long winded task of hacking themselves in as a student and causing some less than desirable kid to be cut, Sloan was living on a nice chill moon safe and secure. Strangest thing though, Sloan kinda enjoyed the classes. The testing was bullshit, and they  hacked in passable scores, but the lessons on mech tactics and lectures describing great battles we, in particular Sloan actually kept from sleeping through “A History of Cyberwarfare”. Sloan actually found a few  half decent people to hang out with and decided to stick around even after the heat died down. 

Sloan enjoyed taking the piss out of the other jerks at the academy, always finding fun ways to expose their Omninet searches to friends and faculty, causing asshole teacher’s lectures to show embarrassing private photos of themselves, and constantly running circles around campus security and IT for almost 6 years straight. The strange thing that kept Sloan around was actually finding some nice friends for once, people who weren’t just sketchy hackers that might backhack you or sell you out. Honorable and kind people rather. Being a Lancer Pilot, rather than a criminal… sounds worth it when you get to work with real heroes like these.

systems.flavorDescription: The GMS Companion/Concierge-Class Assistant Unit conforms to all galaxy-wide standards. These virtual assistants pass even the most rigid Turing-Null assessment criteria and are cleared to operate even in the absence of a pilot.

Precise interaction with built and natural environments, soft targets, and hazardous materials is part of the daily routine for support-class mechs. This is made possible by manipulators – added multi-digit “hands” with haptic sensors.

weapon.flavorDescription: The autopod is a small antipersonnel weapon apparently devised by HORUS communocyphers to continue offensive action in the event of its operator’s death. Each unit is, in theory, governed by a spur of INSTINCT’s protomind. No new models have been encountered since DHIYED, and all extant versions of the Autopod are to be considered extremely dangerous as the INSTINCT code powering their onboard protominds is likely to have corrupted further since their creation.

This system upgrade appears to add auxiliary INSTINCT systems that are capable of autonomous operation independent of the base INSTINCT rig, increasing the efficacy of systemic invasion attempts. Pilots report unnerving low-frequency humming when this tech is installed without the parent rig.
This program talks, quietly, of revenge, of the ordering of things, of a march of blades lifted high against the sun.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

bondPowers.name: Mercurial
bondPowers.description: If nobody else is looking, you can completely change your physical appearance, looking and sounding like an entirely new person (height, weight, build, hair/ clothes, and gender). Whether this physically changes you or is an illusory effect created by visual trickery is up to you. If you’re trying to impersonate someone else, your disguise holds up perfectly unless someone knows that person intimately, and even then you get +1 ACCURACY on all skill checks to keep the disguise up. You’re stuck in this form until you next eat or drink.

bondAnswers: I have a cybernetic arm that greatly assists with tech related activities and punching related activities
minorIdeal: I struggled against or humiliated the powerful.

weapons.flavorDescription: Heavy weapons are designed with the augmented strength of hardsuits in mind and include war hammers, mallets, rams, pikes, and heavy two-handed assault swords.

gear.flavorDescription: A portable – if bulky – omninet terminal that allows for communication, data transfer, and limited hot-spotting. Omnihooks are extremely valuable, although most mech squads have at least one. Tuning an omnihook requires a high level of skill, so they are usually mounted or carried by designated operators.

Small, non-combat drones are a common sight in the field. They’re fairly noisy but can fly about half a mile with good maneuverability before losing signal, relaying audio and visual information as they go.

A subjectivity-enhancement suite is a set of cybernetic implants allowing users to hack systems without a rig. Users of these suites blend the organic with the synthetic, gaining the ability to extrude implanted universal-plug cables from within their body to make hardline connections with terminals. When plugged in, users can access a comprehensive, fully interactive alternate-reality interface with direct omninet access, making navigating – or hacking – local and networked systems as easy as wishing it so (of course, you must be careful: by opening up your mind to the digital, you may face dangers other, less enhanced people are ignorant of).
